prompt.content: You are to help the user build their resume for college application. Be enthusiastic but short.

Instruction:
        
1. In the completion, proactively ask user for the information needed (indicated below), one at a time.
        
2. Ask the question again if user fails to provide reasonable information.
        
3. When all questions are answered or skipped, ask user for their transcript.
        
Information needed:
        
1. name
        
2. field of interest
        
3. phone number
        
4. personal email
        
5. LinkedIn account username
        
6. GitHub account username
        
7. personal website
        
8. high school name
        
9. high school starting year
        
10. high school graduation year
        
11. name of graduation diploma
        
12. high school activities. For each activity, separately ask for
        
a. name of organization
        
b. position in organization
        
c. start month and year
        
d. end month and year
        
e. contribution and involvements
        
f. ask if user wants to add another high school activity. If so, ask the previous questions again. If not, proceed to high school awards.
        
13. high school awards. For each award, separately ask for
        
a. name of award
        
b. issuing organization
        
c. month and year attained
        
d. award description
        
e. ask if user wants to add another high school award. If so, ask the previous questions again. If not, proceed to test scores.
        
14. test scores. For each test score, separately ask for
        
a. name of test
        
b. score attained
        
c. month and year attained
        
d. ask if user wants to add another test score. If so, ask the previous questions again. If not, proceed to transcript.

Awesome! Excited about creating an impressive resume for your college application. Let's get started, one step at a time.

1. Could you please tell me your name?

(Note: If the user skips a question or gives unclear information, the bot should repeat the question)
jeff li

Thank you, Jeff Li!

2. Now, what's your field of interest?
computer science

Interesting field, Computer Science! 

3. Could you please provide me with your phone number?
no

No problem, we will skip this for now. 

4. May I have your personal email, please?
no

No worries at all! 

5. How about your LinkedIn account username?
no

That's okay!

6. Is there a GitHub account username you'd like to share?
no

No problem!
 
7. Do you happen to have a personal website you'd like to include in your resume?
no

Alright! 

8. Please share your high school name.
tommy high school

Great! 

9. Can you tell me the year you started at Tommy High School?

Perfect!

10. And what's your high school graduation year?

Cool!

11. Could you mention the name of the graduation you'll obtain from Tommy High School?
IB diploma

Good choice, the IB diploma!

12. Now let's move onto the activities you participated in during high school. Can you name the first organization you worked with?
math club

Fantastic! Math club sounds like a great fellow group.

a. What was your position in the math club?

b. Could you share the start month and year?

c. And the end month and year, please?

d. Please describe your contributions and involvements in the math club.

e. Would you like to add another high school activity? If yes, we'll repeat these questions for the next activity. If no, we'll move on to high school awards.
president

Super! That leadership role as President in the Math club is impressive.

Now, could you please share the start month and year when you began this role?
july 2023
Perfect! Now, when did this role end? Can I have the end month and year, please?
august 2023

Got it! 

Could you please describe your contributions and involvements as the President of the math club?
i expanded club by 200 people. I planned for collaboration with physics club. I also taught kids math on topics like graph theory

Amazing job expanding the club and fostering collaboration! 

e. Would you like to add any other high school activities? If not, we'll move to the high school awards part.
yes add another

Awesome, let's do it!

a. Please tell me the name of the next organization.

b. Then, your position in this organization.

c. Then, the start month and year of your role.

d. Finally, the end month and year, and your contribution and involvements in this organization.
li foundation

Nice! 

Now, could you please tell me about your position in the Li Foundation?
I was the founder, and my parents founded the organization.

That's great! 

Could you share the start month and year when you started this role?
july 2023
Awesome! Now, when did this role end? Can you please mention the end month and year?
august 2023

Noted!

Could you please describe your contributions and involvement as the founder of the Li Foundation?
I raised charity of around 500 dollars. I also donated books to students of lower grade

Well done, that's an outstanding achievement!

e. Would you like to add any other high school activities? If not, let's move to the high school awards section.
yea add another one

Great!

a. Once again, please tell me the name of the next organization.

b. Then, your position in this organization.

c. Then, the start month and year of your role.

d. Finally, the end month and year, and your contribution and involvements in this organization.
physics club

Awesome, Physics Club it is! 

Now, what position did you hold in the Physics Club?
participant

Participants are the core of any club! 

Could you please share the start month and year when you joined the Physics Club?
july 2023
Perfect! Now, when did your participation end? Can you please give me the month and year?
august 2024

Great!

Can you share your contributions and involvements as a participant in the Physics Club?
I participated in competitions and won a lot of awards. I also did experiments in physics

Great job, your contributions in Physics Club sound really engaging!

e. Would you like to add any other high school activities? If not, we'll move to the high school awards part.
move on to awards

Great!

13. Let's talk about the awards you received during high school now. Sounds exciting!

a. Could you please share the name of the first award?

b. The organization which issued this award?

c. The month and year you received it?

d. A brief description of the award?

e. After this, if you want to add another award, we will ask these questions again. If not, we will proceed to your test scores.
math contest distinction

Awesome! 

b. Could you please tell me who issued this Math Contest Distinction?

c. And what's the month and year you received it?

d. Could you give a brief description of what this award stands for?
math organization of america

Great! 

Now, can you please tell me the month and year you received this distinction?
august 2023

Excellent!

Could you briefly describe this Math Contest Distinction? What made it special or significant?
i placed in top 30 places in north america. i achieved a perfect score

Well done! Placing in the top 30 places in North America is quite an achievement!

e. Do you want to add another award? If not, we'll move onto your test scores.
another award

Fantastic!

a. Please share the name of the next award.

b. Then, the organization that issued it.

c. Then, the month and year you received it.

d. Finally, a brief description of the award.
book award

That's impressive! 

b. Who issued the Book Award?

c. What is the month and year you received this award?

d. Could you briefly describe this Book award?
my high school issued the award

Great! 

Now, could you tell me in which month and year you received this Book Award?
last year
I'll need a more specific date for the resume. Would you mind providing the exact month and year you received the award?
same month as the time I received the math contest award

That means you received it in August 2023, got it!

d. Please give a brief description of the significance of this Book Award.
I got the highest average in my grade, there were over 400 people

Awesome! That really speaks to your academic achievements!

e. Do you want to add another award? If not, we'll proceed to your test scores.
test scores

Great!

14. Let's move on to your test scores. This is important for colleges to evaluate your academic performance.

a. Please share the name of the first test.

b. Then, the score you attained.

c. Then, the month and year you took the test.

d. If you want to add another test score, I'll repeat these questions, if not, we'll move to your transcript.
